meanings.definition: A roundabout way or course taken to avoid something or to visit somewhere along the way.
meanings.sent1: We had to take a detour around the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The road closure forced us to go on a detour through the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The detour we took led us past a beautiful field of flowers.
meanings.sent4: Life sometimes throws unexpected detours our way.
meanings.sent5: The detour added extra time to our journey, but it was worth it to see the scenic route.

meanings.definition: To take a detour; to deviate from a direct or usual route.
meanings.sent1: Let's detour through the park to enjoy the scenery.
meanings.sent2: We had to detour around the fallen tree blocking the road.
meanings.sent3: The GPS detoured us through a small town with quirky shops.
meanings.sent4: She decided to detour from her usual routine and try something new.
meanings.sent5: The river detoured around the massive boulder, creating a unique path.
